stc.h

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 
00002 // Name:        stc.h
00003 // Purpose:     A wxWindows implementation of Scintilla.  This class is the
00004 //              one meant to be used directly by wx applications.  It does not
00005 //              derive directly from the Scintilla classes, and in fact there
00006 //              is no mention of Scintilla classes at all in this header.
00007 //              This class delegates all method calls and events to the
00008 //              Scintilla objects and so forth.  This allows the use of
00009 //              Scintilla without polluting the namespace with all the
00010 //              classes and itentifiers from Scintilla.
00011 //
00012 // Author:      Robin Dunn
00013 //
00014 // Created:     13-Jan-2000
00015 // RCS-ID:      $Id$
00016 // Copyright:   (c) 2000 by Total Control Software
00017 // Licence:     wxWindows license
00019

00187 // Constants for use with SetVisiblePolicy, similar to SetCaretPolicy.
00188 #define wxSTC_VISIBLE_SLOP 0x01
00189 #define wxSTC_VISIBLE_STRICT 0x04
00190 
00191 // Caret policy, used by SetXCaretPolicy and SetYCaretPolicy.
00192 // If CARET_SLOP is set, we can define a slop value: caretSlop.
00193 // This value defines an unwanted zone (UZ) where the caret is... unwanted.
00194 // This zone is defined as a number of pixels near the vertical margins,
00195 // and as a number of lines near the horizontal margins.
00196 // By keeping the caret away from the edges, it is seen within its context,
00197 // so it is likely that the identifier that the caret is on can be completely seen,
00198 // and that the current line is seen with some of the lines following it which are
00199 // often dependent on that line.
00200 #define wxSTC_CARET_SLOP 0x01
00201 
00202 // If CARET_STRICT is set, the policy is enforced... strictly.
00203 // The caret is centred on the display if slop is not set,
00204 // and cannot go in the UZ if slop is set.
00205 #define wxSTC_CARET_STRICT 0x04
00206 
00207 // If CARET_JUMPS is set, the display is moved more energetically
00208 // so the caret can move in the same direction longer before the policy is applied again.
00209 #define wxSTC_CARET_JUMPS 0x10
00210 
00211 // If CARET_EVEN is not set, instead of having symmetrical UZs,
00212 // the left and bottom UZs are extended up to right and top UZs respectively.
00213 // This way, we favour the displaying of useful information: the begining of lines,
00214 // where most code reside, and the lines after the caret, eg. the body of a function.
00215 #define wxSTC_CARET_EVEN 0x08
00216 
00217 // Notifications
00218 // Type of modification and the action which caused the modification.

00220 // One bit is set from each of SC_MOD_* and SC_PERFORMED_*.

01882     // Returns the line number of the line with the caret.

01884 
01885     // Extract style settings from a spec-string which is composed of one or
01886     // more of the following comma separated elements:
01887     //
01888     //      bold                    turns on bold
01889     //      italic                  turns on italics
01890     //      fore:#RRGGBB            sets the foreground colour
01891     //      back:#RRGGBB            sets the background colour
01892     //      face:[facename]         sets the font face name to use
01893     //      size:[num]              sets the font size in points
01894     //      eol                     turns on eol filling
01895     //      underline               turns on underlining
01896     //
01897     void StyleSetSpec(int styleNum, const wxString& spec);
01898

02200 #ifndef SWIG
02201 
02202 inline wxString stc2wx(const char* str) {
02203 #if wxUSE_UNICODE
02204     return wxString(str, wxConvUTF8);
02205 #else
02206     return wxString(str);
02207 #endif
02208 }
02209 
02210 inline wxString stc2wx(const char* str, size_t len) {
02211 #if wxUSE_UNICODE
02212     return wxString(str, wxConvUTF8, len);
02213 #else
02214     return wxString(str, len);
02215 #endif
02216 }
02217 
02218 #if wxUSE_UNICODE
02219 inline const wxWX2MBbuf wx2stc(const wxString& str) {
02220     return str.mb_str(wxConvUTF8);
02221 }
02222 #else
02223 inline const wxWX2MBbuf wx2stc(const wxString& str) {
02224     return str.mbc_str();
02225 }
02226 #endif
02227 
02228 #endif
02229

02232 #endif
